str2: Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To die, be dying, be dead. A strengthened form of a simpler primary thano than'-o; to die.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To call to myself, summon. Middle voice from pros and kaleo; to call toward oneself, i.e. Summon, invite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Latin origin; a centurion, i.e. Captain of one hundred soldiers.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
